panels.description: CPU load in cluster by instance in percent

targets.expr: sum by (instance_name)(node_load1{cluster="$Cluster", instance_name="$Node"}) / count by (instance_name)(node_cpu_seconds_total{cluster="$Cluster", instance_name="$Node", mode='idle'}) * 100

panels.title: CPU load

panels.description:
Used - overall memory usage

Container usage - Current memory usage in bytes,     including all memory regardless of
when it was accessed.

Container Cache - Containers page cache usage

Container Swap - Container swap usage

Contaoner WSS - Containers current working set (OOM)
panels.title: Container Memory Usage

panels.description:
Displays node condition
1 - condition is true
0 - condition is false
panels.title: Node Condition

panels.description: CPU usage by pod in selected instance in cores
panels.title: Pod CPU Usage

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

targets.legendFormat: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable
HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages
AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers
DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free
VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used

matcher.options: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)

panels.description: Memory usage by pod in selected instance in bytes
panels.title: Pod Memory Usage

targets.legendFormat: CurrEstab - TCP connections with state ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use
UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use
UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
AttemptFails - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT and SYN-RCVD
EstabResets - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
InCsumErrors - Segments received with checksum errors
InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)
InSegs - Segments received, including those received in error. Includes segments received on established connections
OutRsts - Segments sent containing the RST flag
OutSegs - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets
RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
SynChallenge - Challenge ACKs sent in response to SYN packets
InErrors - Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
RcvbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to receive
SndbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to transmit
NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InErrors - Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
RcvbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to receive
SndbufErrors - Datagrams for which not enough socket buffer memory to transmit
NoPorts - Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
OutRedirects -  Redirect messages sent. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects
InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
OutErrors - Messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers

panels.description: Network bandwidth by pod in selected instaince in bytes/sec, excluding pods with host network enabled

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_receive_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1)) + sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1))

panels.title: Network Bandwidth

targets.expr: topk(20, sort_desc(sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_receive_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1)) by (namespace, pod) + sum(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_receive_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1)) by (namespace, pod)))

panels.description: Network receive bandwidth of pods in selected instance  in bytes/sec, excluding pods with host network enabled

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_receive_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1))

panels.title: Network Receive Bandwidth

targets.expr: topk(20, sort_desc(sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_receive_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1)) by (namespace, pod)))

panels.description: Network transmit bandwidth of pods in selected instance in bytes/sec, excluding pods with host network enabled

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1))

panels.title: Network Transmit Bandwidth

targets.expr: topk(20, sort_desc(sum(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", pod!=""}[1m]) * on(pod) group_left() (count by (pod)(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{interface=~"eth.+"}) == 1)) by (namespace, pod)))

panels.description: Filesystem throughput of pods in selected instance  in bytes/s

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) + sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m]))

panels.title: Filesystem Throughput

panels.description: TOP Pod filesystem throughput per namespace/pod in bytes

targets.expr: topk(20, sort_desc(sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) by (namespace, pod) + sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) by (namespace, pod)))

panels.title: TOP Pod Filesystem Throughput

panels.description: Filesystem IOPS of pods in selected instance  in bytes/s

targets.expr: sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_fs_reads_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) + sum by(namespace, pod)(rate(container_fs_writes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m]))

panels.title: Filesystem IOPS

panels.description: TOP Pod filesystem IOPS per namespace/pod in bytes

targets.expr: topk(20, sort_desc(sum(rate(container_fs_writes_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) by (namespace, pod) + sum(rate(container_fs_reads_total{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node", container!='', container!="POD"}[1m])) by (namespace, pod)))

panels.title: TOP Pod Filesystem IOPS

panels.description: Ready pods in selected instance in # of pods

targets.expr: count((kube_pod_status_phase{cluster="$Cluster", phase="Running"} == 1 and on(cluster, pod) kube_pod_info{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node"}) and on(pod) (kube_pod_status_ready{cluster="$Cluster", condition="true"} == 1))

panels.title: Ready pods

panels.description: Unready / Pending pods in selected instance in # of pods

targets.expr: count((kube_pod_status_phase{cluster="$Cluster" , phase="Running"} == 1) and on(cluster, pod) kube_pod_info{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node"}) and on(pod) (kube_pod_status_ready{cluster="$Cluster", condition="true"} == 0) or vector(0)
count(kube_pod_status_phase{cluster="$Cluster", phase="Pending"} == 1 and on(cluster, pod) kube_pod_info{cluster="$Cluster", node="$Node"}) or vector(0)

panels.title: Unready / Pending pods

targets.legendFormat: Is clock synchronized to a reliable server (1 = yes, 0 = no)
Time offset in between local system and reference clock
